people.name: Emperor Gao
people.note: Liu Bang. Also known as Gao Zu. Usually referred to as the Supreme Ancestor.

people.name: Emperor Guangwu
people.note: Liu Xiu.

people.name: Emperor Xian
people.note: Liu Xie.

people.name: Cao Jie
people.note: One of the Ten Regular Attendants.

people.name: Cai Yong
people.note:: Privy Counselor of the Late Han court. Executed by Wang Yun for mourning the death of Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Zhang Rang
people.note: One of the Ten Regular Attendants.

people.name: Zhao Zhong
people.note: One of the Ten Regular Attendants.

people.name: Feng Xu
people.note: One of the Ten Regular Attendants.

people.name: Duan Gui
people.note: One of the Ten Regular Attendants.

people.name: Hou Lan
people.note: One of the Ten Regular Attendants.

people.name: Jian Shuo
people.note: One of the Ten Regular Attendants.

people.name: Chen Kuang
people.note: One of the Ten Regular Attendants.

people.name: Xia Yun
people.note: One of the Ten Regular Attendants.

people.name: Guo Sheng
people.note: One of the Ten Regular Attendants.

people.name: Zhang Jue
people.note: Also known as Zhang Jiao.

people.name: Zhuang Zi
people.note: The Taoist sage known as The Old Hermit From Mount Hua Summit.

people.name: Prince Gong
people.note: Prince Gong of Lu, ancestor of Liu Yan.

people.name: Liu Sheng
people.note: Prince Jing of Zhongshan. Ancestor of Liu Bei.

people.name: Emperor Jing
people.note: Fourth Han emperor. Ancestor of Liu Sheng, Prince Jing of Zhongshan.

people.name: Liu Zhen
people.note: Son of Liu Sheng, Prince Jing of Zhongshan.

people.name: Liu Xiong
people.note: Father of Liu Bei.

people.name: Liu Hong
people.note: Father of Liu Xiong. Grandfather of Liu Bei.

people.name: Liu Yuanqi
people.note: Uncle of Liu Bei.

people.name: Zheng Xuan
people.note: One of Liu Bei's teachers, along with Lu Zhi.

people.name: Gongsun Zan
people.note: Governor of Beiping. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Cao Song
people.note: Father of Cao Cao. Originally a Xiahou, he was adopted by the eunuch Cao Teng.

people.name: Cao Teng
people.note: Adopted father of Cao Song.

people.name: Sunzi
people.note: Also known as Sun Wu. More famously known as Sun Tsu, author of The Art of War. Ancestor of Sun Jian.

people.name: Xu Chang
people.note: A rebel defeated by Sun Jian.

people.name: Xu Shao
people.note: Son of Xu Chang.

people.name: Ou Xing
people.note: Staged an uprising in Changsha.

people.name: Zhang Ju
people.note: Staged an uprising in Yuyang, along with Zhang Chun.

people.name: Zhang Chun
people.note: Staged an uprising in Yuyang, along with Zhang Ju.

people.name: Empress He
people.note: Mother of Liu Bian (Emperor Shao).

people.name: Emperor Shao
people.note: Liu Bian.

people.name: Lady Wang
people.note: Also known as Beauty Wang or Consort Wang. Mother of Liu Xie (Emperor Xian).

people.name: Liu Chang
people.note: Lord of Jiedu. Father of Emperor Ling.

people.name: Yuan Shao
people.note: Lord of Qixiang and governor of Bohai. Led the alliance against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Yuan Feng
people.note: Father of Yuan Shao.

people.name: Yuan Wei
people.note: Uncle of Yuan Shao.

people.name: Xun You
people.note: Nephew of Xun Yu. Left the Inner Bureau during Dong Zhuo's usurpation, later becoming an officer of Cao Cao.

people.name: Dong Chong
people.note: Brother of Empress Dong.

people.name: He Miao
people.note: Brother of He Jin.

people.name: Lady Wuyang
people.note: Mother of He Miao.

people.name: Niu Fu
people.note: Son-in-law of Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Li Jue
people.note: One of Dong Zhuo's generals. Occupied the capital with Guo Si after Dong Zhuo's death.

people.name: Guo Si
people.note: One of Dong Zhuo's generals. Occupied the capital with Guo Si after Dong Zhuo's death.

people.name: Zhang Ji
people.note: One of Dong Zhuo's generals who later served Li Jue and Guo Si.

people.name: Fan Chou
people.note: One of Dong Zhuo's generals who later served Li Jue and Guo Si. Executed by Li Jue after failing to pursue Han Sui.

people.name: Yuan Shu
people.note: Governor of Nanyang and General of the Rear. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Cui Lie
people.note: Commandant of the Capital Gates.

people.name: Bao Xin
people.note: Lord of Jibei. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo. Killed later while fighting the Yellow Turbans.

people.name: Yi Yin
people.note: A minister of the Shang dynasty.

people.name: Tai Jia
people.note: A sovereign of the Shang dynasty.

people.name: Li Su
people.note: Persuaded Lü Bu to join Dong Zhuo and kill Ding Yuan. Later joined Wang Yun's plot against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Dong Min
people.note: Brother of Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Chen Gong
people.note: County official who helped Cao Cao escape after he failed to assassinate Dong Zhuo, but left after Cao Cao murdered Lü Boshe. Later became Lü Bu's strategist.

people.name: Han Fu
people.note: Imperial inspector of Jizhou. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Kong Zhou
people.note: Imperial inspector of Yuzhou. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Liu Dai
people.note: Imperial inspector of Yanzhou. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Wang Kuang
people.note: Governor of Henei. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Zhang Miao
people.note: Governor of Chenliu. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Qiao Mao
people.note: Governor of Dongjun. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Yuan Yi
people.note: Governor of Shanyang. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Kong Rong
people.note: Governor of Beihai. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Zhang Chao
people.note: Governor of Guangling. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Tao Qian
people.note: Imperial inspector of Xuzhou. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo. Cao Cao's father Cao Song was murdered by Tao Qian's officer Zhang Kai, giving Cao Cao cause to invade. Died of illness during the invasion, leaving his territory to Liu Bei.

people.name: Ma Teng
people.note: Governor of Xiliang. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo. Appointed Conqueror of the West by Emperor Xian.

people.name: Zhang Yang
people.note: Governor of Shangdang. Joined the alliance against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Huang Wan
people.note: Commander of the Capital Districts. Participated in Wang Yun's plot against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Xun Shuang
people.note: Minister of Works during Dong Zhuo's occupation.

people.name: Xu Rong
people.note: Governor of Yingyang under Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Bian He
people.note: Presented a rock to the King of Chu. The jade inside was made into the imperial seal.

people.name: The First Emperor
people.note: Qin Shi Huang, personal name Zhao Zheng. Unified China under the Qin Dynasty.

people.name: Li Si
people.note: Prime minister of Qin Shi Huang, the First Emperor.

people.name: Ziying
people.note: Last ruler of Qin.

people.name: Wang Xun
people.note: Follower of Wang Mang.

people.name: Su Xian
people.note: Follower of Wang Mang.

people.name: Liu Biao
people.note: Imperial inspector of Jingzhou. One of the Eight Paragons of Jiangxia.

people.name: Chen Xiang
people.note: One of the Eight Paragons of Jiangxia.

people.name: Fan Pang
people.note: One of the Eight Paragons of Jiangxia.

people.name: Kong Yu
people.note: One of the Eight Paragons of Jiangxia.

people.name: Fan Kang
people.note: One of the Eight Paragons of Jiangxia.

people.name: Tan Fu
people.note: One of the Eight Paragons of Jiangxia.

people.name: Zhang Jian
people.note: One of the Eight Paragons of Jiangxia.

people.name: Cen Zhi
people.note: One of the Eight Paragons of Jiangxia.

people.name: Cai Mao
people.note: Naval officer under Liu Biao who surrendered to Cao Cao.

people.name: Peng Ji
people.note: Advisor to Yuan Shao. Proposed attacking Han Fu.

people.name: Xun Chan
people.note: Advisor to Han Fu.

people.name: Xin Ping
people.note: Advisor to Han Fu.

people.name: Xu You
people.note: Advisor to Yuan Shao. Defected to Cao Cao at the battle of Guandu.

people.name: Gongsun Yue
people.note: Brother of Gongsun zan.

people.name: Ma Midi
people.note: Imperial Guardian of the Han court during Dong Zhuo's usurpation.

people.name: Lady Wu
people.note: Wife of Sun Jian. Mother of Sun Ce, Sun Quan, Sun Yi, and Sun Kuang.

people.name: Sun Ce
people.note: Eldest son of Sun Jian.

people.name: Sun Quan
people.note: Second son of Sun Jian. Founder of Wu.

people.name: Sun Yi
people.note: Third son of Sun Jian.

people.name: Sun Kuang
people.note: Fourth son of Sun Jian.

people.name: Lady Wu's sister
people.note: Second wife of Sun Jian. Mother of Sun Lang and Sun Ren (Sun Shangxiang).

people.name: Sun Lang
people.note: Son of Sun Jian by his second wife.

people.name: Sun Shangxiang
people.note: Daughter of Sun Jian by his second wife. Also known as Lady Sun or Sun Ren.

people.name: Sun Shao
people.note: Adopted son of Sun Jian.

people.name: Sun Jing
people.note: Younger brother of Sun Jian.

people.name: Lady Cai
people.note: Second wife of Liu Biao. Sister of Cai Mao.

people.name: Huan Jie
people.note: Retrieved Sun Jian's body from Liu Biao in exchange for the prisoner Huang Zu.

people.name: Dong Huang
people.note: Nephew of Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Zhang Wen
people.note: Minister of Public Works during Dong Zhuo's usurpation.

people.name: Diaochan
people.note: Also written as Diao Chan. Daughter of Wang Yun.

people.name: Yi Yin
people.note: Preceptor of the Shang dynasty.

people.name: Zhougong
people.note: Duke of Zhou. Regent for the child emperor Chengwang.

people.name: Jiang Xiong
people.note: Saved King Zhuang of Chu from Qin soldiers.

people.name: Shisun Rui
people.note: A supervisor in the Secretariat. Participated in Wang Yun's plot against Dong Zhuo.

people.name: Taoist priest
people.note: A mysterious Taoist priest who appeared at Dong Zhuo's coronation ceremony.

people.name: Sima Qian
people.note: Author of the Records of the Grand Historian.

people.name: Zhuge Liang
people.note: Brilliant strategist of Shu.

people.name: Jia Xu
people.note: Advisor to Dong Zhuo's remnants under Li Jue, Guo Si, Zhang Ji, and Fan Chou.

people.name: Hu Chi'er
people.note: Officer of Niu Fu. Murdered Niu Fu and presented his head to Lü Bu, but was executed when Lü Bu learned of his treachery.

people.name: Peng Yue
people.note: General of Liu Bang who fought Chu using reverse signaling tactics -- advancing at the gong and retreating at the drum.

people.name: Li Meng
people.note: After Dong Zhuo's death, he and Wang Fang opened the gates to the capital from the inside to let in Dong Zhuo's remnant forces. Captured by Ma Chao after failing to heed Jia Xu's advice.

people.name: Wang Fang
people.note: After Dong Zhuo's death, he and Li Meng opened the gates to the capital from the inside to let in Dong Zhuo's remnant forces. Killed in battle by Ma Chao after failing to heed Jia Xu's advice.

people.name: Chong Fu
people.note: Minister of Ritual in the imperial Han court. Died during the sacking of Chang'an by Dong Zhuo's remnant forces.

people.name: Lu Kui
people.note: Court Steward of the imperial Han court. Died during the sacking of Chang'an by Dong Zhuo's remnant forces.

people.name: Zhou Huan
people.note: Minister of Protocol in the imperial Han court. Died during the sacking of Chang'an by Dong Zhuo's remnant forces.

people.name: Wang Qi
people.note: Commandant of the Exemplary Cavalry. Died during the sacking of Chang'an by Dong Zhuo's remnant forces.

people.name: Han Sui
people.note: Imperial inspector of Bingzhou. Ally of Ma Teng. Appointed Queller of the West by Emperor Xian.

people.name: Ma Yu
people.note: Privy Counselor of the Han court after the death of Cai Yong. Assisted Ma Teng and Han Sui's rebellion against Li Jue and Guo Si, but was caught and executed.

people.name: Chong Shao
people.note: Assisted Ma Teng and Han Sui's rebellion against Li Jue and Guo Si, but was caught and executed.

people.name: Liu Fan
people.note: Assisted Ma Teng and Han Sui's rebellion against Li Jue and Guo Si, but was caught and executed.

people.name: Ma Chao
people.note: Son of Ma Teng. After Ma Teng's death, served Zhang Lu. Submitted to Liu Bei after two inconclusive duels with Zhang Fei.

people.name: Xun Yu
people.note: Son of Xun Gun. Uncle of Xun You. First served Yuan Shao before becoming Cao Cao's chief advisor.

people.name: Xun Gun
people.note: Father of Xun Yu.

people.name: Zhang Liang
people.note: Advisor to Emperor Gao. Cao Cao referred to Xun Yu as his Zifang.

people.name: Cheng Yu
people.note: Advisor of Cao Cao, recommended by Xun Yu.

people.name: Guo Jia
people.note: Advisor of Cao Cao, recommended by Cheng Yu and Xun Yu.

people.name: Liu Ye
people.note: An officer of Cao Cao, recommended by Guo Jia. Descendant of the imperial family.

people.name: Man Chong
people.note: An officer of Cao Cao.

people.name: Lü Qian
people.note: An officer of Cao Cao.

people.name: Mao Jie
people.note: An officer of Cao Cao.

people.name: Yu Jin
people.note: An officer of Cao Cao known for his archery skills.

people.name: Dian Wei
people.note: An officer of Cao Cao. A large man of great strength who previously had served Zhang Miao. Wielded dual steel spears.

people.name: Elai
people.note: An officer of the Shang dynasty whose strength was legendary.

people.name: Ying Shao
people.note: Governor of Taishan. Sent by Cao Cao to bring back his father Cao Song.

people.name: Cao De
people.note: Younger brother of Cao Song.

people.name: Zhang Kai
people.note: Former Yellow Turban assigned by Tao Qian to escort Cao Cao's father Cao Song through Tao Qian's territory. Instead, he killed Cao Song and looted his belongings, bringing Cao Cao's wrath upon Tao Qian.

people.name: Bian Rang
people.note: Governor of Jiujiang. Brought an army to aid Tao Qian when Cao Cao invaded Xuzhou.

people.name: Cao Bao
people.note: Officer of Tao Qian.

people.name: Mi Zhu
people.note: Officer of Tao Qian.
